website_summaries.verdict: Nintendo Labo is a fun and unique Switch add-on -- a Lego-meets-Ikea cardboard construction set that will unlock kids’ real-world creativity.
pros: Labo's software and games are fun to play and explore
There's a lot to do, and a sense that many secrets await unlocking
cons: The kits can be daunting for younger kids
There's a risk of things breaking, so handle with care
And, where do you store all those large cardboard things later on?

customer_reviews.title: Unique and Fun
customer_reviews.text: My 7YO son and I spent 3 hours getting through a few of the projects taking a break after the fishing one. The whole setup is done really well, from the clarity of the cardboard to the really detailed instructions. It’s about 99% foolproof. Kudos to Nintendo for coming up with this. With so many digital games, it’s nice to actually create something tangible. Hope they make more of these Labo kits.
customer_reviews.author: Tony R.L.

customer_reviews.title: Fun for mom and kids :)
customer_reviews.text: Super fun for kids and Mom. Fishing game works very well - super responsive to movements with no perceptible lag. Motorcycle game is also quite good, with both handlebar turning and leaning reflected in game play - wish we could use that toy-con to control the vehicles in MarioKart! I’ll update again once we’ve done the rest. Definitely a team effort with a six year old to avoid damaging the cardboard during assembly. I hope they release the blueprints so more durable versions could be made if desired, although no issues yet! Tip: Watch the fishing lesson in "Discovery" to learn how to catch bigger fish.
customer_reviews.author: E. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Tons of fun building and playing, even as an adult!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 25 year old male, and I will admit I just bought it for myself. It was incredibly fun to build everything, and some of the games have some good replay-ability. The piano is a blast to return to, the motorbike is really fun, and the fishing is nice and relaxing. There's quite a bit here. I definitely recommend getting the variety kit for sure,
customer_reviews.author: Kevin V.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: It's not cheap, but it is definitely worth the money if your kid is into building. My son is 11 years old. He has been building the accessories since he got it yesterday. There are still quite a few to go. Nintendo must have made these perfect because he has not had one problem fitting pieces and he has done it all by himself. Not sure if we will be buying the other kits, but this one is great.
customer_reviews.author: RGFFSAN

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely fun! Combining the building times of all five projects, you have about 7-10 hours of construction (which is more interesting than you think) and after that some of the minigames for the projects are a blast! Not only that, it teaches kids about engineering, infrared cameras, motion sensors, as well as vibration and how it creates sounds. So yes, it's well worth the $70.
customer_reviews.author: SuperMoose

customer_reviews.title: Great idea
customer_reviews.text: Very fun for my nine year old. A couple of the more elaborate sets were a little tough for him so he needed help. I love that it’s something kids need to put together and follow instructions for, but they’re motivated by screen time at the end. Some of the sets he put together a couple of months ago are coming apart now though. Even not being used that much, the little tape with sensors is just coming off of the cardboard. There are a lot of small pieces to keep together too, until all sets are assembled. My nine year old really enjoys the Nintendo Labo concept.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product
customer_reviews.text: I really loved watching my son assemble the different items in this kit. They were well boxed and labeled and the digital work instructions were amazingly clear and well done. I work for a manufacturing company and I would love to see work instructions built this well! My son is 10 and easily navigated the instructions and then once they were built had a great time using what he made with the game it came with. So much better than just playing a video game all day. He had to use both motor skills and his mind to get the task completed. Thanks Nintendo!
customer_reviews.author: BrazilianKitty

customer_reviews.title: and I especially love the fact that it's a tactile experience that takes ...
customer_reviews.text: Kept my 10 year old busy for days, and I especially love the fact that it's a tactile experience that takes him AWAY from the screen for a while and really forces him to create things in 2-dimensional space. We've since purchased the other Labo kits and they're all really clever and exceptionally well-designed. Also surprisingly sturdy given that they're made of cardstock and paper! We've designated a shelf for all of the completed kits so he can spare them the wrath of his little brothers. Brilliant learning tool with surprisingly fun games.
customer_reviews.author: Head Cheeze

customer_reviews.title: Video game and craft project combined!
customer_reviews.text: Just gave this to our 11-year old son for xmas. Of all the gifts he received, this was the first one he opened to play with. He sat perfectly content all day putting the different projects together. The directions are clear and easy to follow - he needed no adult help with any of them. In a time when all kids want to do is play video games, this is an excellent hybrid - it involves using the Nintendo Switch (video games) BUT it also combines building a hands-on project which helps kids work on developing their fine motor skills, hand-eye coordination, spatial reasoning and creative thinking to name a few. Definitely plan to purchase additional sets!
customer_reviews.author: He Sed, She Sed

customer_reviews.title: Great for non-screen time.
customer_reviews.text: got this for my 11 year old who loves it, it takes him a while to make each of the items and then he has fun playing with them. the only down fall is that he has to punch out each cardboard piece but that also leaves tons of scrap cardboard pieces all over my floor. That has more to do with his tendency to not clean up after himself then it does the product because I don't see a way around that. Part of punching out the pieces is the fun. And it has plenty of spare parts so if you accidently rip or tear or bend a piece you'll likely have a spare.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Poulsen

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Just wow. My husband and son started working on these projects Christmas Day. The end result of both projects that have been completed has been extremely cool. This kit has tons of projects for the value and is engaging and fun! It refreshes his interest in the Nintendo switch more than just another game ever could. My husband is also obsessed and has not been able to put it down. Highly recommend I know for sure the other kits will be in my cart when they finish all the projects in this box!
customer_reviews.author: L. Breda

customer_reviews.title: Best $70 box of cardboard ever
customer_reviews.text: It might feel hard to sign up to pay for a box of cardboard. Fear not, mamas and papas, this is the best $70 cardboard ever. My 10 year old son spent HOURS enthralled with the projects and so buoyed by the successful building as he went along, that we had to pry him away from his work to eat dinner. Then back to it he went. He loves it and I love that he's feeling totally independent working on the construction aspect. Well done, Nintendo. Take my money.
customer_reviews.author: mama donuts

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: When I first saw this, I thought “over priced cardboard”. But it was the ONLY THING my son asked for for his birthday. After reading reviews, I decided to go for it. I am so glad I did. My son (who just had his 10th birthday) is half way through this box, and he has sat for cumulatively 12 hours working on this!! And the creations are amazing. My 14 year old has also enjoyed the creations too, everyone takes a turn at them and are amazed. It has brought all of us together. This kit is SO COOL !!!!
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GIFT
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson's birthday. He was bored and had just lost most of his possessions in the hurricane. Once he got this gift, it made his day. This kept him busy for days. He particularly liked the piano and house. I was amazed at all the things he could make with it. Even though the items were made from cardboard, they were sturdy and held up well. I would differently purchase another kit like this.
customer_reviews.author: SHAROLYN H.

customer_reviews.title: A great gift for Switch enthusiasts.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 9 year old grandson for Christmas. From the moment he opened it, his attention was hooked. Every piece is well constructed cardboard and comes with step by step instructions. Each piece takes anywhere from 30 minutes to an hour to construct. It may seem a bit pricey but for the quality of the materials and easy to follow instructions, it was well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: K Piper

customer_reviews.title: Fun to build... Then what
customer_reviews.text: Labo is a very interesting product in the video game sphere. It is basically a building game that you can then play video games with. The games you end up being able to play are novel at best. I would recommend this to someone who has a kid and wants an activity to do together with them. After you are done building everything you are just left with a bunch of cardboard stuff that you will be wondering what to do with.
customer_reviews.author: jarrettkerpan

customer_reviews.title: Japanese Packaging but U.S.A. Labo Game Cartridge- Works so far!
customer_reviews.text: I really freaked out at first because the item I received was the Japanese version of the Nintendo Labo Variety Kit...NOT the U.S.A. Version as pictured or described in the product details or many reviews. I thought I’d been mislead by all the terrific reviews, and was screwed with less than a week until Christmas. I decided to test the game cartridge and was happy to discover that the game works perfectly, all English language, no glitches or issues. Other than the Japanese packaging it’s exactly the same as what you’d get in an American retail store. I’m giving 4 stars for the near fatal heart attack and the underwear I ruined when I opened the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Lukemakesmusic

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous invention! Keeping son busy! Great gift!
customer_reviews.text: My son got this, the Labo robot kit and customization kit for his main 9th birthday gifts. He had a robot themed party. He absolutely loved it, spent the next couple days assembling stuff and still playing with the items. He was able to assemble independently by following the on screen instructions. I love the idea of combining the hands on building/thinking aspect with the technology/game aspect, and he gets to move around and/or manipulate stuff while playing with the items. It has kept his interest & I think I’m gonna get more Labo items for Christmas, maybe the guitar for sure.
customer_reviews.author: brollyhock

customer_reviews.title: Cardboard is king
customer_reviews.text: A ton of cardboard fun, weeks worth of it take your time making them have fun playing with them fun for everyone fixes for the cardboard and everything to you can decorate them anyways you want and even make your own, its really neat and unique never seen anything like this before, IF I were a kid id go crazy for those, what do kids love more then toys, the cardboard box it comes in, this is a perfect gift idea for kids, or maybe even for your cat to lay in if you or your kids get tired of it haha! a really cool fun game
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: We all love Labo!
customer_reviews.text: Here’s the review of my 10 year old boy: It’s so cool! I love it! When you make it you feel like “what will happen when I finish it?”. When you play there are so many mysteries! Like the house, when you put two buttons or all buttons. In discover section you see how it works or whats inside and in garage you can make everything! We’ve had so many hours of fun! Thanks Nintendo!
customer_reviews.author: A. GONZALEZ

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised!
customer_reviews.text: I must admit - I was skeptical! This is, after all, a fairly expensive set of cardboard pieces! But my 9 yo opened it up Christmas morning, and started assembling right away! Assembly was easy - no parental involvement required - and the games that go along with the different parts were actually really cool! I'm happy with this purchase, and I highly recommend to anyone considering it!
customer_reviews.author: justMYopinion

customer_reviews.title: Nintendo is smart
customer_reviews.text: Let's make a video game that parents wont feel guilty for letting their kid play. This is it. A model bldg kit and video game in one. Fun, interesting and requires some work to put things together. It's almost like... fun! Fun that doesn't require your kid to get sucked into a screen for hours. I'd love to see more of this.
customer_reviews.author: joolzy

customer_reviews.title: Would Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband as a birthday present. The price is a bit high, but I think it's the perfect gift for older children and even adults with an interest for STEM related activities. It can take a while to assemble parts together, but comes with clear instructions, so any older child with adult help can easily do it. Good fun for adults that like to build things and game as well. Very cool, and perfect for those that have the interest and patience to put together everything.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Schalk

customer_reviews.title: Fun Variety Kit!
customer_reviews.text: The Labo Variety Kit is a great interactive kit for both children and adults! Although, it wasn't the easiest to set up, I think it took me 45 mins to set up the house but once completed, my son was addicted. He played it until the cardboard started to tear and the pieces would no longer fit. These cardboard creations don't last long but are still fun to play. The games are fun and interactive and it really is fun for the entire family! I would definitely recommend purchasing this item.
customer_reviews.author: Karina

customer_reviews.title: Super fun projects!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my nine year old since school was cancelled for a month and now we’re doing online classes. He needed something to do with all his free time and I thought this would be perfect, plus it has a built in reward at the end.... video games! He did it all by himself with no adult help, except when my husband wanted to build one also- they worked together. So there you go, fun for kids and grown-ups.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy D

customer_reviews.title: Son is spellbound
customer_reviews.text: I have never seen anything hold my son's attention like this. He is almost 8 and is so dedicated to building these pieces The joy he gets when he finishes a creation is beyond anything I had ever hoped. My favorites so far are the motorcycle and the fishing rod but there are still more to be built. I thought we would have to help him but the way Nintendo developed the directions is so clear and organized that he has built most without any help at all. I am floored by both the construction aspect and the enjoyment of the creation made. This is a must buy for switch owners!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy B

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This was such a great gift 4 my grandson 10th birthday! He literally worked on the 1st 2 projects 4 8 hrs straight...he loved it! Yes....it's all cardboard...but they have 2 spend time time watching, thinking and creating...great product 4 the price. HIGHLY recommend! Grandparent WIN!
customer_reviews.author: Nant

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous about this, because it was kind of expensive. But it was totally worth it. My 11-year-old son loves it! The items to build are intricate and hold his attention, and he plays with them even after they are built. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all ages (once built, of course)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I love playing with my switch but also doing crafts and diys. The instructions that come in the included game are super easy to follow. I wouldn’t recommend this to young kids because of just how difficult and time-consuming the builds can be. However, once the “toycon” (as they’re called) are finished, they are super easy and fun to use for anyone of any age! Overall, at $30 I believe this set is a great buy for teens (like me) who have way too much time on their hands or as an activity for parents to do with their kids.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for curious and patient kids
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loved this!! The stickers are easy to use incorrectly, especially with the kiddos, but overall this was a great gift, and kept him busy and engaged for days as he put it together... and he loved every second!!
customer_reviews.author: LoB

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this
customer_reviews.text: My son (9) and his friend (13) spent most of a weekend building all of the contraptions in this set. Some of the games aren't that fun, but he really enjoyed constructing all of the pieces. He and his friend were able to build everything without any help from adults, and he gets easily frustrated. They seem to hold up pretty well for cardboard, but he isn't using them everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: A very clever use of cardboard and video games.
customer_reviews.text: Pro: - Easy for kids to put together - Fun to do - The cardboard is really sturdy Con: - Once you are done there isn't much replayability
customer_reviews.author: Wiiviewer

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I thought the kids would spend a fun day putting the pieces together and then we'd end up throwing it all away, but they've been playing with it for months, practically every day, without any signs of tiring. The pieces have been stepped on a few times and taken apart and put back together, but it all still works great! I was really surprised at how great the Labo was!
customer_reviews.author: Tynley Bean

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but not a first game for switch
customer_reviews.text: This was more fun to build than play. My boys (8&10) had a lot of fun building these, but only one person can play at a time. So it’s nit a good first game for the switch since everyone wants a turn and there really isn’t a stopping point for these games.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Vargo

customer_reviews.title: Great but hard to store afterwards
customer_reviews.text: This is so worth the money and keeps the kids busy for a long time! The on screen instructions were easy enough for my 10 year to follow so she could build the different projects on her own with little assistance. My only complaint is that they are hard to store because they don’t break down. They are big and bulky. Also, my dog apparently found the cardboard fun to chew on, so keep away from animals!
customer_reviews.author: A. Bartley

customer_reviews.title: what a hit
customer_reviews.text: my 10 yo son has completely enjoyed this so much - and it was an item that I was wondering if it would be liked at all. all the different tasks that go along with this coupled with the crafting skills required to build....."Santa" was good this year.
customer_reviews.author: crazyalzado

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! My 12 yr old ADHD/ASD son spent hours building things! It was awesome to see him able to sit down and focus without distractions or fits. This is a big achievement in our house.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: From a kid's perspective
customer_reviews.text: Nintendo labo is a kit of cardboard cutouts that you build and interact. Using the Nintendo Switch gaming console, kids and kids at heart will have fun. It is a stem educational toy that is entertaining to build and play because it combines both physical and virtual play. It is appropriate for all ages but not recommended for young kids because it is easy to break and not waterproof. I would recommend it because labo has lots of different varieties of kits. For example, some things you get in this kit are a fishing rod and a piano.
customer_reviews.author: Snilsen

customer_reviews.title: Good quality creative fun
customer_reviews.text: My son bought this with money he earned. I was skeptical but got it for him since the reviews were so good. He loves it! He hasn't needed my help. He is 11 and likes to build/make things. I like it is video game related but adds a different creative element. The cardboard is sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and innovative product from Nintendo
customer_reviews.text: My 4 your old son is able to build the pieces himself by following the instructions on the screen. You can't imagine the satisfaction they get when he actually build a device from scratch by himself before actually enjoying the games. Excellent and innovative product from Nintendo!
customer_reviews.author: Billy Leung

customer_reviews.title: Very pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazingly fun experience. I was very surprised by the quality of the constructed items and the amount of replay value the individual games would have. My son and I had a lot of fun putting these together and he's still having fun with the mini games. Can't wait to pick up the next Labo set and build that robotic suit!
customer_reviews.author: Brian H

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I bought the variety kit for my three children, ages 7, 9, 11. They love it. So far, it's endless fun of STEM. My 9 and 11 year old were able to lead the way in putting things together, while still involving my 7 year old in the assembling process. My husband and I were not needed at all. They were able to put everything together and operate everything by themselves. They are so excited and not bored with it yet. I'm amazed with this technology.
customer_reviews.author: LaToia Williams

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Interactive Kit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson's 11th birthday. He spent hours putting together the various items and had a great time. When finished creating all the items, he proudly demonstrated each.
customer_reviews.author: Carol G.

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this.
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old built ever card board contraption himself. Some of them took hours. He is very pleased with the set and wants more of them. I don't know how long they will last, but he said it was sturdy cardboard and all of them worked. Now I need to figure out how to store them because they are all over the house.
customer_reviews.author: Windswept

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for your inner child
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for myself after wanting it for a while, and I have zero regrets. It is absolutely worth the money. Instructions are clear and well-made. Resulting toy-cons are solid and fun as hell to use. This is a must have game for the Switch. I'm hoping to pick up the other packs soon, as I absolutely adore Labo now.
customer_reviews.author: notmadeofbeef

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old son absolutely loved this! He spent hours building the different kits and then showing them off to friends and family. This feels more like old school building and learning than video gaming to me and I loved how busy it kept him. The RC cars are so neat because they have a camera that shows on the switch screen where it’s going and what the car ‘sees.’ I think those and the fishing pole were my son’s favorites!
customer_reviews.author: mkp2012

customer_reviews.title: Totally awesome toy/videogame!
customer_reviews.text: This is the coolest thing ever. My son, he's 8, has had so much fun with it. And, he can make all of these without any help - the directions are phenomenal. And even though he can do it himself, me, my wife, and his much older sister, have all been doing it with him because it's so cool. Probably the best bang for my buck of any toy I've bought in years.
customer_reviews.author: Deep_Diver

customer_reviews.title: Exciting Way to Learn!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 7 year old to help him work on building while playing. He has learned so far to be patient especially when folding or the whole thing will be off. He enjoy what he built and even enjoy the fishing game. It is alot of steps,but I say overall it was worth it. I would definitely get him more once we are done with the box.
customer_reviews.author: Kay's Mom

customer_reviews.title: We absolutely love this product
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this product. My son went through one product at a time and really enjoyed following the directions and seeing how things were going to come together in the end. He is ready for the robot and car kit :) All the projects included in the kit worked well with the software.
customer_reviews.author: BMDavis

customer_reviews.title: Innovative experience perfect for a young boy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 8 year old son. He loves it. The one thing that disappointed me intially with the switch is it didn’t transform that gaming experience the way that WII sports did. While this is different type of experience, it is completely innovative. Perfect for a young boy. Strongly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: D. DeDecker

customer_reviews.title: Tons of fun
customer_reviews.text: Had a blast putting this together and playing the games with my five year old girl. She was able to put most of the sets together herself with minimal help. Great buy if you have a switch and young kids.
customer_reviews.author: IRISH

customer_reviews.title: All of the self-built inventions work extremely well and are surprisingly more fun than the advertising had led me to believe
customer_reviews.text: This product really exceeded my kid's expectations as well as mine. We had no idea how versatile the switch really was until we bought the Labo. All of the self-built inventions work extremely well and are surprisingly more fun than the advertising had led me to believe. It's a little pricey, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for My 10 Years Old Grandson
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my nearly 10 years old grandson. He loves it. A Christmas gift for him... he opened it and assembled several of the available projects. Nice for the Nintendo Switch.
customer_reviews.author: Pedum

customer_reviews.title: 10 stars
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this 10 stars I would! It is soo amazing. If you have a switch, you need this. The sturdy cardboard kits need to be constructed and the switch gives step by step instructions. It’s constructive building time. Then each instrument/ activity interact with each other. We are finding something new everyday.
customer_reviews.author: summertime

customer_reviews.title: Expensive But Your Kids Will Like It
customer_reviews.text: My daughter absolutely loved this, would NOT go to bed till she built every single project. She and her brother had so much fun. A little pricey in my opinion, but I've wasted more money on things that turned out to be pathetic. This is actually really good.
customer_reviews.author: RTShadow

customer_reviews.title: Keeps kids entertained for a WHILE!!!
customer_reviews.text: Has 5 total projects? My kid made 3 and then kinda got tired of working. My kid needed very little help. Once done, the projects are fun to play with for like 20 minutes then they get repetitive. I recommend the experience for kids that like to build.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Cool

customer_reviews.title: Great birthday present for 9yr old!
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old said this was his favorite birthday present! He worked on it nonstop when he got and even woke up early the next morning to keep working on it! I do wish it came with an easy way to store all the different things though. It was all very creative!
customer_reviews.author: Travelingmom

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: My 8 (almost 9) year old loved this! Probably his favorite Christmas gift. I highly recommend this for any kid with a Switch and an interest in how things work and building with their hands.
customer_reviews.author: SCK

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Gave to my daughter who is 10 years old as a reward for completing school assignment. She could just build them all without help. It's pretty amazing what kids can do and enjoy things nowadays. It's well guided and everything works perfectly. Very smart product!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Jones

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely stunning and positively BRILLIANT!
customer_reviews.text: I teach high school economics and had a group of my most intelligent seniors come in after school. It was incredible to watch them have such a fun and engaging experience with the Labo, an endeavor from Nintendo that has married our modern technology with the creative and irreplaceable hand-made engineering that is so often neglected. 10/10 and 2 hours of joy and excitement.
customer_reviews.author: Fair-Witness

customer_reviews.title: GET THIS! ZERO REGRETS!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is beyond my expectations! Santa got this for a 10, 9, & 7 yr olds. It came with an app for the Switch, and it gave visual step-by-step instructions. They then used the items that they built as equipment for the Switch to play, similar to arcade games. SO FANTASTIC on so many different levels - working together, building, then using their constructions to play. Nice job, Nintendo.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This is really creative, and a lot of fun to build. I am very impressed with all the effort that went into it. My son and I are having a lot of fun building these. I highly recommend this. I am looking forward to new sets.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Love these sets! We got this and the robot set and hope to see more in the future. 10 year old spent hours putting these together without any help and felt very accomplished when they were completed. She then painted them and decorated them to make them “cooler.”
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Porter

customer_reviews.title: Cool game
customer_reviews.text: 11 y/o son got this as a Christmas present. The game has easy to follow directions that display from start to finish. Son was able to put the random holders together himself. When each mini game is built you can play it. Pretty cool.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: A great gift
customer_reviews.text: A great gift for my husband. He said the only recommendation or complaint he would say is that you need to find storage for it. Since it is something you build and if you live in a smaller space, it's hard to find somewhere to store the multiple games.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Not as cool as you thought
customer_reviews.text: My daughter got bored with this pretty quick. We made the fishing pole and yeah it’s kind of cool. But, after about an hour of play we haven’t played it since. Better off buying a fun game to play
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: The turn point view and building breakdown make the creations super easy and engaging
customer_reviews.text: The garage software included with the game card alone is well worth the price. The turn point view and building breakdown make the creations super easy and engaging. It's basic coding 101 plus your own customized parts throughout, and the hours that can be put into this are greatly looked forward.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Fantastically Creative Product
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality build instructions that are easy for a child to follow and feel a sense of accomplishment with. Once completed, kids will have a blast with the creatively fun games and ingenuity built into the each user interfaces. The set even includes optional lessons that teach kids about electrical accelerometers, gyroscopes, magnetometers, infra red transmitters and receivers, etc., which helps them understand the mechanics of each project. I hope they make many more of these sets.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell A. Westbury

customer_reviews.title: Great family activity
customer_reviews.text: Really nice product to do a bit different entertainment with your console together with kids. I like quality of materials, as well as software is really good. Good investments, considering many days of fun with this thing and even with full price I would say it worth it., but better to by on sale for sure :)
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir Golev

customer_reviews.title: Not English version as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Not as advertised! this product is in Japanese and not the English version as stated in the description and photos. Please correct the description or remove the item! Also the box has been opened
customer_reviews.author: Aaron G.

customer_reviews.title: Really Cool Game
customer_reviews.text: When I bought the nintendo labor for my son, he loved it so much that he played the creations for months now, this is not only a game but you get to create which is cool as a parent to know.
customer_reviews.author: KIRTI

customer_reviews.title: VERY CREATIVE
customer_reviews.text: MY 5 YR OLD KID LOVES THIS! GREAT FOR THOSE BUDDING ENGINEERS. ENCOURAGES READING SKILLS TOO. ACTIVE PHYSICAL ENGAGEMENT , STEP BY STEP INSTRUCTIONS. SUPER INVENTIVE! ENCOURAGES INGENUITY. NOT PLASTIC WHICH IS A BIG PLUS FOR US
customer_reviews.author: Suzie

customer_reviews.title: Cool but...
customer_reviews.text: Kid played with it once or twice and then forgot about it.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: My son spent hours putting together and even created some of his own creations. He has not even finished making everything and I think it was worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Gallimore

customer_reviews.title: Very fun and eco-friendly
customer_reviews.text: My 11 year old son LOVES this. I love the idea that he's building with his hands instead of just digitally. I was worried about them being not so sturdy but the cardboard holds up very well. Will have to invest in the other Labo kits.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney

customer_reviews.title: Japanese version
customer_reviews.text: The picture showed the English version, but what we got was the Japanese version. Since we don't read Japanese, our 11 year old son could not build it.
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT LEARNING TOOL. AND FUN!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My 10 yr old grandson is in love with the inventions he can make with this learning tool. Can’t really call this a toy. He is learning as he works with it.
customer_reviews.author: C Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely a great gift for kids with Nintendo Switch!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a 10 year old and an 8 year old grandchild, and they both love it! They FaceTime me showing the things they created and how they work. I wasn’t sure which games they had for the Nintendo Switch, so this was an ideal choice.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for me and the kids
customer_reviews.text: My kids and I have had a great time putting these together and playing the games. The games are not great, they almost feel like an after thought. Some of the assembly is quite involved so your kids might need help, but that is half the fun.
customer_reviews.author: Chunky

customer_reviews.title: All ages
customer_reviews.text: Nintendo Labo is great! Some people say it’s hard but I friend I know has a 7 years old who got the car racing one and built it himself. I personally think this is the best one since there is a variety.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: has been going over well
customer_reviews.text: husband and kids both like. More durable than expected. That Japanese engineering! Seems to manage quite tight tolerances for cardboard.
customer_reviews.author: Josephine Burns

customer_reviews.title: Great well thought out product
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! My son received this as a gift for his 10th birthday. He loved building each unit and then loves to play the game with this items he built. Fishing is the favorite at our house!
customer_reviews.author: Marion Hern

customer_reviews.title: Ninten- do it!
customer_reviews.text: A ridiculous amount of fun for the price. If you like Legos or building things, you will love this. My five and eight year old had a blast as well as my wife and her parents! The cat meowing piano had us all laughing on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: J Finn

customer_reviews.title: immersive for your child
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES his Nintendo Labo Kit! He built everything in about four days all on his own. Tests how each build works and interacts with his Switch. He looks forward to getting the Robo and Auto!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I received a damaged box
customer_reviews.text: Maybe just received a damaged box, item seems to be intact, haven't used it yet. Looking forward to set it up with my kids :)
customer_reviews.author: Umer

customer_reviews.title: got the wrong item???
customer_reviews.text: I am hoping that it's an honest mistake but I got the Japanese version of this kit. We were so excited when it came but when we opened it, it was in Japanese. I re-read the product info where I bought and nothing was indicated that the product is in Japanese. I am returning it ASAP and just bought another one. Hopefully the one arriving in 2 days is the right product.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Z

customer_reviews.title: What a fabulous way to make Nintendo interactive
customer_reviews.text: This is a great activity!!! My 6 yr old is loving building each item and the games are perfect for the tools he is building.
customer_reviews.author: Jill M B

customer_reviews.title: Labo teaches kids how things works.
customer_reviews.text: The build is the best part. Getting kids to follow directions and learn a little physics. Very good product for kids. "Rome wasn't built in a day." Take your time and enjoy wonderful new games. The motor cross was just like Mario Carts. Plenty of opportunities to Modify and make your own designs.
customer_reviews.author: Micki Johnson

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: Kids enjoyed building it and playing the games included. Assembled pieces take up quite a bit of space.
customer_reviews.author: PSHORTS

customer_reviews.title: They were easy to make and are incredible the way they work ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the coolest!! My 12 year old worked for days getting these made. They were easy to make and are incredible the way they work with the Switch! I was worried about the price for cardboard but it’s so much more than that!!! I recommend this for any kid who loves to build and game!!! Terrific!!
customer_reviews.author: Tabatha Myers

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, ingenious product
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, ingenious product! You fold the cardboard into shapes and insert your Nintendo Shift and controllers into projects that really work! The Fishing experience is my favorite so far. You'll wonder how in the world it knows where the real fishing line is. Foolproof instructions, animated on the Switch screen. Immensely satisfying!
customer_reviews.author: David Levitt

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic item for kids to have and create !
customer_reviews.text: Omg I got this for my grandsons 9th birthday he requested it . It is fantastic he loves it ! He stared making thing’s immediately. I can’t wait to purchase more of the cardboard for him to make more ! It’s very creative .
customer_reviews.author: Linda Bader

customer_reviews.title: Ordered twice, both times came in Asian packaging
customer_reviews.text: Both kits came in packing that I couldn’t read. Not the English version
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hess

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really fun and hand on. Hope they will have more kit come out later.
customer_reviews.author: RY Tsui

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely genius idea
customer_reviews.text: I don’t often do reviews but this product is pure genius! My son absolutely loved working on these and then playing with the finished product. I will be buying ALL the different Labo projects. So worth it!! Thank you Nintendo Labo for saving our sanity during Covid social distancing!!
customer_reviews.author: Abbey Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like it because it had a lot of cardboard pieces and for the price that was too much money for cardboard pieces
customer_reviews.author: loretta

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun and lots of work folding cardboard pieces
customer_reviews.text: Great activities with this one and lots of cardboard folding (hours upon hours worth of it, not kidding). The games are fun and the piano is the best of all. Tons of fun! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: cpbunnyart on eBay

customer_reviews.title: Thank you Nintendo!
customer_reviews.text: This has exceeded our expectations! Our 9 year old loved building the various cardboard devices, and playing the accompanying game with it. Well worth it especially if you have a switch already. This will entertain your kid for hours / days.
customer_reviews.author: Susan1212

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old LOVED this. Great compromise between video game activity and crafts.
customer_reviews.author: R. Finlayson

customer_reviews.title: Top notch quality
customer_reviews.text: The cardboard is madr if excellent quality and the videos are easy to follow for children to assemble the parts themselves, and they are entertaining
customer_reviews.author: selchki

product_meta.title: Nintendo Labo - Variety Kit
product_meta.description: Edition:Variety KitStart with a piece of cardboard and build yourself one of five different Toy-Con projects, such as a 13-key piano, a fishing pole, or even a motorbike. Add your Nintendo Switch console to power it up and you can hold a recital, catch a fish, or win a race, respectively. Entertainment Software Rating Board (ESRB) Content Description: Mild Cartoon Violence.
feature_bullets: The Variety Kit includes five different projects to Make, Play, and Discover: two Toy-Con RC Cars, a Toy-Con Fishing Rod, a Toy-Con House, a Toy-Con Motorbike, and a Toy-Con Piano!
Bring each Toy-Con creation to life with the power of the Nintendo Switch console and Joy-Con controllers
Discover the fun of customizing Toy-Con creations with your own stickers, markers, paint, new parts, and other original crafting ideas
Experiment with a fun and powerful in-game visual tool in Toy-Con Garage, where you connect input, output, and middle nodes to create your own basic or elaborate ideas for Toy-Con creations!

A free software update is available for Mario Kart 8 Deluxe, allowing you to use the Toy-Con Motorbike to control your in-game vehicles. Enjoy every game mode and every vehicle type with this immersive, interactive controller option that makes you feel like you’re really in the driver’s seat! (Mario Kart 8 Deluxe sold separately)
